form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Cortez Masto (for herself and Mrs. Hyde-Smith) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt sports betting from the tax on authorized wagers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Withdrawing Arduous Gaming Excise Rates Act or the WAGER Act.

section.header: Sports betting exempt from the excise tax on authorized wagers

subsection.text: Section 4402 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Sports betting not prohibited under State law or Tribal compact

clause.text: the law of the State in which accepted, or
an approved Tribal-State gaming compact executed in accordance with the Indian Gaming Regulatory Act (25 U.S.C. 2701 et seq.), and

subparagraph.text: is placed with respect to any sporting event.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to wagers placed after the date of the enactment of this Act.
